Title: Supply of Telecare Equipment
Description:
This framework agreement is for the Supply of Telecare Equipment and covers the requirements of Leeds City Council for goods being delivered directly to Assisted Living Leeds and also to Middlesbrough Borough Council's Ayresome Industries.
Tenderers should be aware that this is a 12 month framework with approval obtained to re-procure for the following two subsequent years, at the Council's discretion with the final 12 month framework expiring 31st March 2020. This is to provide as much flexibility as possible by providing the opportunity for the Council to update the product specifications, provide new suppliers' access to the framework and existing suppliers the chance to upgrade their products.
During each framework the Council may identify and trial any new telecare products and include these product specifications in the tender exercise for the following 12 month framework. This also provides Suppliers with the opportunity to propose any new products and apply for the framework on an annual basis.
Products included within the framework tender documents are categorised as • Alarm Units • Pendants • Internal alerts • Bed Sensors • Chair Sensors • Light Sensors • Universal Sensors • Falls Detector • Home Safety • Door alarm • Pill Dispenser • Memory aid • Sensory Equipment • Epilepsy sensor • Lifestyle Systems • GPS • Miscellaneous

Title: Voluntary Tagging and Location Monitoring of Offenders
Description:
The Yorkshire and Humberside Policing Forces require a sole supplier for the Provision of an Electronic Location Monitoring System using GPS trackers, including other associated devices and externally hosted IT for voluntary tagging of suspects and offenders as part of each Forces Integrated Offender Management Schemes.

The contract will be for two years with options to extend for two further 12-month periods, which will be at the total discretion of each Policing Force. Each Force will enter into a separate contract with the awarded supplier.



The following Police Forces have been identified to have or may require this service and will be able to utilise this contract - 

-	West Yorkshire Police
-	North Yorkshire Police
-	Humberside Police
-	South Yorkshire Police
-	Cleveland Police
Contact Address 1: South Yorkshire Police, Carbrook House, 5 Carbrook

Title: Northamptonshire County Council Assistive Technology Framework
Description: This Framework is for the Service and Supply only of Electronic Assistive Technology Equipment for residents of Northamptonshire Social Services. The main aim of the service is to support independent living through use of Assistive technology. The main objective of the service is to help people in need of support to maintain their independence and their health and wellbeing in their chosen home for as long as possible and: • To prevent people from moving into institutional care • To prevent hospital admission • To assist speedy transfer of care from hospital • To create efficiencies in the delivery of Social Services • To support positive outcomes for disabled children, young people and adults

Title: Supply of Telecare Equipment
Description: 9XBC-PN5I7A: Supply of Telecare Equipment This framework agreement is for the Supply of Telecare equipment which will provide Community benefits by promoting and maintaining the independence and well-being of the residents who require such support. This is a collaboration between Leeds City Council and Middlesbrough Council Tenderers should be aware that this is a 12 month framework with approval obtained to reprocure for the following three subsequent years, at the Council's discretion, with the final 12 month framework expiring 31st March 2020 . This is to provide as much flexibility as possible by providing the opportunity for the Council to update the product specifications, provide new suppliers access to the framework and existing suppliers the chance to upgrade their products. Due to the flooding experienced by many organisations including Assisted Living Leeds, the deadline for tender submissions has been extended to 12 noon Wednesday 3rd February 2016, however, tenderers should be aware that the evaluation process may also take longer than usual due to the additional emergency workload that has been placed upon members of the evaluation panel. Once stage one of the evaluation process (the desktop assessment) has been concluded, thereafter the request for samples will confirm revised dates and delivery address as appose to those indicated in the Tender Instructions document. These delays may affect the intended framework start date, as originally detailed in the tender documentation, if it becomes a necessity a new framework start date will be communicated as soon as possible prior to the award of the framework.
